intro: Myriophyllum tenellum, commonly known as watermilfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to North America. It has slender, branching stems that are often mistaken for aquatic grasses. The plant produces small, green, rounded leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. It thrives in freshwater environments such as lakes, ponds, and slow-moving streams. Myriophyllum tenellum plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various aquatic organisms.
